thread.title: Alastair Cook: Factfile: Alastair Nathan Cook​
thread.title_full: Alastair Cook: Factfile: Alastair Nathan Cook​

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: Alastair Cook: Factfile: Alastair Nathan Cook​
text:
LONDON: Factfile on Alastair Cook , who stepped down as England 's Test captain on Monday:
Name: Alastair Nathan Cook
Date of birth: December 25, 1984 (Age: 32)
Place of birth: Gloucester, England
Role: opening batsman (left-handed)
Domestic team: Essex (2003-present)
International team: England (2006-present)
Test debut: March 1, 2006 against India
Test caps: 140
Test runs: 11,057
Test batting average: 46.45
Test 100s/50s: 30/53
Top score: 294 (against India, August 2011)
One-day debut: June 28, 2006 against Sri Lanka
One-day caps: 92
One-day runs: 3,204
One-day batting average: 36.40
One-day 100s/50s: 5/19
Top score: 137 (against Pakistan, February 2012)
Individual awards
Denis Compton Award (Most Promising Young Player in England): 2003, 2004, 2005, 2006
CWC (Cricket Writers' Club) Young Cricketer of the Year: 2005
PCA (Professional Cricketers' Association) Young Cricketer of the Year: 2005, 2006
ICC (International Cricket Council) Test Player of the Year: 2011
Wisden Cricketer of the Year: 2012
Other
Freedom of the City of London: 2011
Member of the Order of the British Empire (MBE): 2011
Commander of the Order of the British Empire (CBE): 2016
